programme.desc: Francine visits Finland, where the threat from Russia looms large. She speaks to President Alexander Stubb about Finnish resilience and how his country is preparing for an uncertain future.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Close
programme.desc: Romaine Bostick and Katie Greifeld break down the day's top market-moving stories and trading action around the closing bell.

programme.title: Bloomberg: Balance Of Power
programme.desc: Bloomberg Balance of Power focuses on politics and policies on Capitol Hill, in President Trump's administration, the federal agencies and the courts.

programme.title: The Deal With Alex Rodriguez And Jason Kelly
programme.desc: The hosts talk with USC Annenberg School for Communication and Journalism Dean Willow Bay about her investment in Angel City Football Club and her tenure on 'NBA Inside Stuff.'

programme.title: Bloomberg The Asia Trade
programme.desc: Live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping markets.

programme.title: Bloomberg: The China Show
programme.desc: Your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. Hosted by Yvonne Man and David Ingles.

programme.title: Insight With Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: The definitive guide for global news audiences to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day, through probing interviews and nuanced conversations.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: Linking the market drivers from overnight in the US and across Asia into the region's trading day, with deep dive analysis of the top business, energy and geopolitical stories shaping decisions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: Live from London, we catch you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. Plus, we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

programme.title: Bloomberg: The Opening Trade
programme.desc: Everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. We break down today's biggest stories and speak to guests with skin in the game. Hosted by Anna Edwards, Guy Johnson and Kriti Gupta.

programme.title: Bloomberg Brief
programme.desc: Delivering the market news, data and analysis you need to set your agenda.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
programme.desc: Daily conversations with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond. Hosted by Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Annmarie Hordern.

programme.title: Bloomberg Open Interest
programme.desc: Bloomberg Open Interest with Matt Miller and Dani Burger - delivers the market-moving news you need to know to get a jump start on the US trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Tech
programme.desc: The only daily live technology program with a focus on breaking news, market-moving reporting and analysis of global technology companies and stories.

programme.title: Bloomberg Real Yield
programme.desc: A weekly show on fixed income with the biggest names in the field, covering sovereign and credit markets as investors grapple with fiscal, monetary and financial factors.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets
programme.desc: Bloomberg Markets is focused on bringing you the most important global business and breaking markets news and information as it happens.

programme.title: Bloomberg: Balance Of Power
programme.desc: Bloomberg Balance of Power focuses on politics and policies on Capitol Hill, in President Trump's administration, the federal agencies and the courts.

programme.title: Bloomberg Businessweek Daily
programme.desc: Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec bring you reporting from the magazine that helps global leaders stay ahead, plus insight on the people, companies and trends shaping today's complex economy.

programme.title: Killer Safari

programme.title: Killer Safari
programme.desc: Life in the African bush is a game of survival, for both hunter and hunted. Add babies to the mix and you‚Äôll see astounding feats of courage as mothers risk life and limb to protect their young. In spring, tall grass helps babies hide out of sight, but it also camouflages predators on the prowl. This game drive captures extraordinary behaviour as families and individuals battle to eat, defend, and raise young.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: Animals wage a covert war for survival, deploying their hidden weapons with deadly precision. These adaptations, forged by eons of evolution, give animals the edge they need to outwit predators, rivals, and the elements. From the bombardier beetle's boiling spray to the mantis shrimp's explosive club and the draco lizard‚Äôs hidden wings, meet nature's awesome secret weapons.

programme.title: Killer Safari
programme.desc: Hungry crocs battle a dangerous pod of hippos. The hippos take on a group of male lions. programme.title: Snakes In The City

programme.title: Prairie Dog Manor
programme.desc: For the Prairie Dogs in northern New Mexico, winter has nearly come. In the Highlands, Carl and the pups prepare for hibernation, but an unlikely alliance of deadly predators creates a heightened threat for every dog in the territory.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin dares into the Australian savannah to find the species most built to survive. First is Australia‚Äôs largest bird of prey, the majestic but intimidating wedge-tailed eagle. Next, Phil tracks down one of the world‚Äôs deadliest snakes, the coastal taipan. Finally, Phil faces the uniquely Australian frill-necked lizard, a reptile with fascinating defense mechanisms.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads into the mangroves to discover which animal is truly built to survive the mud and muck. He encounters a feisty mud crab with huge pincers and catches a shovel-nosed ray with his bare hands. programme.title: America's Wild Spaces

programme.title: America's Wild Spaces
programme.desc: Papahanaumokuakea Marine National Monument, encompasses the Northwestern Hawaiian Islands. A month long scientific expedition will journey to these remote waters to map the uncharted.

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: The coastal realm of land and sea is home to two of nature‚Äôs most iconic females ‚Äì orca and grizzly bears. Under the waves in the Gulf of California, the orca family‚Äôs success relies on the experience of their sixty-year-old matriarch; while on the beaches of Alaska, a first-time bear mother must raise her three cubs alone and with only her instincts to guide her.

programme.title: Europe's New Wild
programme.desc: In the Carpathian mountains and other wildlife strongholds, nature is being given a helping hand. The reintroduction of European Bison and the spread of the Grey wolf across the continent signal a wildlife comeback which is benefiting not only other animals but humans as well..

programme.title: Queens

programme.title: Europe's New Wild
programme.desc: In Italy and Croatia, efforts to save a rare species of bear are helping many other animals to thrive and landscapes to flourish.

programme.title: Europe's New Wild
programme.desc: The Danube River carves its way eastwards from the Black Forest in Germany, three thousand kilometres to the black sea in the East, where it splits into hundreds of braided channels running across 1600 square miles of the Danube Delta. The river feeds a diversity of habitats, home to over 300 spectacular wetland birds, over 40 mammals, and hundreds of amphibians, fish and insects. .

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: In the heart of Tanzania, the towering walls of the Ngorongoro crater sets a stage for one of the most infamous rivalries in the natural world. The sisters of a formidable lion pride clash with a hyena clan ruled by an all-powerful queen. The sisterhood share responsibility, while the hyena queen must play clan politics and enforce a strict hierarchy to keep her crown.

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: Under the rainforest canopy of Central America is a secret world ruled by insects. Two tiny queens will give everything to build their empires. The ant queen will sacrifice her own body for the future of her growing colony while the beautiful orchid bee will stop at nothing for success; betraying those closest to her.

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: The Congo Forest in Central Africa is home to a secretive animal we still know very little about. Bonobos are one of our closest relatives, but in their society it‚Äôs females who rule. A young bonobo must leave behind her family, to find her place in the world. Here, friendship is the key to survival. She must make new friends and impress the alpha female before she can truly fit in.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol: Compilation
programme.desc: Jeepers! That‚Äôs something you don‚Äôt see every day. In this special episode, Dr. Pol‚Äôs expertise and intuition will be put to the test by the strangest and most amazing cases. A cat thinks the world is spinning, a Jack Russell has painful eyes, and a baby pony is fainting. Time to put the book smarts to the test! .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol: Compilation
programme.desc: Let the wild ruckus begin! The vets are up to their stethoscopes in chaotic cases. Dr. Pol powers through the turmoil to treat spunky mini-horses and an ornery goose on the loose. Meanwhile, Dr. Brenda tangles with a pregnant mare in dire straits, and Dr. Lisa has her hands full with a cranky cow perforated by a porcupine.

programme.title: Wild Argentina: Extreme Earth
programme.desc: Whether right whales, penguins or sea lions - for the birth of their young, many marine creatures are drawn to Argentina's nearly 5,000 kilometer coastline. From their very first breath, it's all about one thing for the little ones: survival. Orcas hunt for young sea lions with a special technique and seagulls fly merciless aerial attacks on baby whales.

programme.title: Wild Argentina: Extreme Earth
programme.desc: In Argentina's breathtaking, yet imposing wilderness, every day is a fight for survival. The terrain is rugged and parched. The air is thin. The weather can change in an instant. And then there are the predators. A female puma stalks a valley in search of guanaco, while a tarantula defends itself against a hungry armadillo. Foxes will scavenge what they can‚Ä¶until one of the world‚Äôs largest vultures shows up.
